/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: bidTypeId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This corresponds to the tender.items.classification._id

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: notBidTypeId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This corresponds the negated bidTypeId filter, matches elements that are NOT in the TreeSet of Ids

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: procuringEntityId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This is the id of the organization/procuring entity. Corresponds to the OCDS Organization.identifier

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: notProcuringEntityId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This corresponds the negated procuringEntityId filter, matches elements that are NOT in the TreeSet of Ids

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: supplierId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This is the id of the organization/supplier entity. Corresponds to the OCDS Organization.identifier

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: bidSelectionMethod
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethodDetails. Valid examples are Đấu thầu rộng rãi, Đấu thầu hạn chế, etc...

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: notBidSelectionMethod
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This corresponds the negated bidSelectionMethod filter, matches elements that are NOT in the list of Ids

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: contrMethod
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after tender.contrMethod.id, Values range from 1 to 5.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: planningLoc
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after planning.budget.projectLocation._id

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: tenderLoc
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after tender.items.deliveryLocation._id

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: procurementMethod
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethod

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: procuringEntityCityId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will search after the City Id of the procuring entity.The field is organization.address.postalCode

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.department._id

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: procuringEntityGroupId
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.group._id

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: year
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: month
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: pageNumber
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: pageSize
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: minTenderValue
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: maxTenderValue
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: minAwardValue
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: maxAwardValue
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: electronicSubmission
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: Filters after tender.submissionMethod='electronicSubmission', also known as eBids

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: flagged
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: Only show the releases that were flagged by at least one indicator

/api/activeAwardsCount get.name: monthly
/api/activeAwardsCount get.description: When true, this parameter will add an extra layer of monthly grouping of all results. The default is false

/api/awardValueInterval post.description: This will search after the City Id of the procuring entity.The field is organization.address.postalCode

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: procuringEntityGroupId

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: year
/api/awardValueInterval post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: month
/api/awardValueInterval post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: pageNumber
/api/awardValueInterval post.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: pageSize
/api/awardValueInterval post.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: minTenderValue

/api/awardValueInterval post.name: maxTenderValue

/api/countTendersByYear post.name: monthly
/api/countTendersByYear post.description: When true, this parameter will add an extra layer of monthly grouping of all results. The default is false

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: bidTypeId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This corresponds to the tender.items.classification._id

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: notBidTypeId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This corresponds the negated bidTypeId filter, matches elements that are NOT in the TreeSet of Ids

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: procuringEntityId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This is the id of the organization/procuring entity. Corresponds to the OCDS Organization.identifier

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: notProcuringEntityId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This corresponds the negated procuringEntityId filter, matches elements that are NOT in the TreeSet of Ids

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: supplierId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This is the id of the organization/supplier entity. Corresponds to the OCDS Organization.identifier

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: bidSelectionMethod
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethodDetails. Valid examples are Đấu thầu rộng rãi, Đấu thầu hạn chế, etc...

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: notBidSelectionMethod
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This corresponds the negated bidSelectionMethod filter, matches elements that are NOT in the list of Ids

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: contrMethod
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.contrMethod.id, Values range from 1 to 5.

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: planningLoc
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after planning.budget.projectLocation._id

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: tenderLoc
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.items.deliveryLocation._id

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: procurementMethod
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethod

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: procuringEntityCityId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will search after the City Id of the procuring entity.The field is organization.address.postalCode

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.department._id

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: procuringEntityGroupId
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.group._id

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: year
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: month
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: pageNumber
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: pageSize
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: minTenderValue
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: maxTenderValue
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: minAwardValue
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.name: maxAwardValue
/api/flags/i002/crosstab get.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: tenderLoc
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This will filter after tender.items.deliveryLocation._id

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: procuringEntityCityId
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This will search after the City Id of the procuring entity.The field is organization.address.postalCode

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: procuringEntityGroupId

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: year
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: month
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: pageNumber
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: pageSize
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: minTenderValue
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: maxTenderValue
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: minAwardValue
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: maxAwardValue

/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: Filters after tender.submissionMethod='electronicSubmission', also known as eBids

/api/flags/i002/stats post.name: flagged
/api/flags/i002/stats post.description: Only show the releases that were flagged by at least one indicator

/api/flags/i038/releases get.name: month
/api/flags/i038/releases get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/flags/i038/releases get.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.name: year
/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.name: month
/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.name: pageNumber
/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.name: pageSize
/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/flags/i077/crosstab post.name: maxTenderValue

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: notProcuringEntityId
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This corresponds the negated procuringEntityId filter, matches elements that are NOT in the TreeSet of Ids

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: supplierId
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This is the id of the organization/supplier entity. Corresponds to the OCDS Organization.identifier

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: bidSelectionMethod
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethodDetails. Valid examples are Đấu thầu rộng rãi, Đấu thầu hạn chế, etc...

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: notBidSelectionMethod
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This corresponds the negated bidSelectionMethod filter, matches elements that are NOT in the list of Ids

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: contrMethod
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.contrMethod.id, Values range from 1 to 5.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: planningLoc
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after planning.budget.projectLocation._id

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: tenderLoc
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.items.deliveryLocation._id

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: procurementMethod
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethod

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: procuringEntityCityId
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will search after the City Id of the procuring entity.The field is organization.address.postalCode

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.department._id

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: procuringEntityGroupId
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.group._id

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: year
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: month
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: pageNumber
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: pageSize
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: minTenderValue
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: maxTenderValue
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: minAwardValue
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: maxAwardValue
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: electronicSubmission
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: Filters after tender.submissionMethod='electronicSubmission', also known as eBids

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: flagged
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: Only show the releases that were flagged by at least one indicator

/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.name: monthly
/api/flags/i171/crosstab get.description: When true, this parameter will add an extra layer of monthly grouping of all results. The default is false

/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.department._id

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: procuringEntityGroupId
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.group._id

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: year
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: month
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: pageNumber
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: pageSize
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: minTenderValue
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: maxTenderValue
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: minAwardValue
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: maxAwardValue
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: electronicSubmission
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: Filters after tender.submissionMethod='electronicSubmission', also known as eBids

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: flagged
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: Only show the releases that were flagged by at least one indicator

/api/flags/i171/stats post.name: monthly
/api/flags/i171/stats post.description: When true, this parameter will add an extra layer of monthly grouping of all results. The default is false

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: year
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: month
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: pageNumber
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: pageSize
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: minTenderValue
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: maxTenderValue
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: minAwardValue
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.name: maxAwardValue
/api/ocds/bidTimelineExcelChart post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/ocds/cancelledTendersByYearByRation.name: month
/api/ocds/cancelledTendersByYearByRation.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/ocds/cancelledTendersByYearByRation.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: pageNumber
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: pageSize
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: minTenderValue
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: maxTenderValue
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: minAwardValue
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: maxAwardValue
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: electronicSubmission
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: Filters after tender.submissionMethod='electronicSubmission', also known as eBids

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: flagged
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: Only show the releases that were flagged by at least one indicator

/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.name: monthly
/api/ocds/numberTendersUsingEBidExcelCha.description: When true, this parameter will add an extra layer of monthly grouping of all results. The default is false

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: year
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: month
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: pageNumber
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: pageSize
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: minTenderValue
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: maxTenderValue
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: minAwardValue
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: maxAwardValue
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: flagged
/api/ocds/release/all post.description: Only show the releases that were flagged by at least one indicator

/api/ocds/release/all post.name: monthly

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: tenderLoc
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will filter after tender.items.deliveryLocation._id

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: procurementMethod
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethod

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: procuringEntityCityId
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will search after the City Id of the procuring entity.The field is organization.address.postalCode

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.department._id

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: procuringEntityGroupId
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.group._id

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: year
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: month
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: pageNumber
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: pageSize
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: minTenderValue
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: maxTenderValue
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: minAwardValue
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: maxAwardValue
/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/percentOfEligibleProjectsFlaggedByY.name: electronicSubmission

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: notBidSelectionMethod
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This corresponds the negated bidSelectionMethod filter, matches elements that are NOT in the list of Ids

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: contrMethod
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after tender.contrMethod.id, Values range from 1 to 5.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: planningLoc
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after planning.budget.projectLocation._id

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: tenderLoc
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after tender.items.deliveryLocation._id

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: procurementMethod
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after tender.procurementMethod

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: procuringEntityCityId
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will search after the City Id of the procuring entity.The field is organization.address.postalCode

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: procuringEntityDepartmentId
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.department._id

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: procuringEntityGroupId
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will search after the DepartmentId of the procuring entity.The field is organization.group._id

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: year
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: month
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: pageNumber
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: pageSize
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: minTenderValue
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: maxTenderValue
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: minAwardValue
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: maxAwardValue
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: electronicSubmission
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: Filters after tender.submissionMethod='electronicSubmission', also known as eBids

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: flagged
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: Only show the releases that were flagged by at least one indicator

/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.name: monthly
/api/plannedFundingByLocation post.description: When true, this parameter will add an extra layer of monthly grouping of all results. The default is false

/api/tenderValueInterval get.name: procuringEntityGroupId

/api/tenderValueInterval get.name: year
/api/tenderValueInterval get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on year. The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/tenderValueInterval get.name: month
/api/tenderValueInterval get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/tenderValueInterval get.name: pageNumber
/api/tenderValueInterval get.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/tenderValueInterval get.name: pageSize
/api/tenderValueInterval get.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/tenderValueInterval get.name: minTenderValue

/api/tenderValueInterval get.name: maxTenderValue

The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/topTenLargestAwards get.name: month
/api/topTenLargestAwards get.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/topTenLargestAwards get.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/topTenLargestAwards get.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

The minimum year allowed is 1900 and the maximum allowed is 2200.It will check if the startDate and endDate are within the year range. To check which fields are used to read start/endDate from, have a look at each endpoint definition.

/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.name: month
/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.description: This parameter will filter the content based on month. The minimum month allowed is 1 and the maximum allowed is 12This parameter does nothing if used without the year parameter, as filtering and aggregating by month makes no sense without filtering by year. This parameter is also ignored when using multiple year parameters, so it only works if and only if the year parameter has one value.

/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.name: pageNumber
/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.description: This is the page number to be displayed. If unspecified it starts with the first page which is page 0

/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.name: pageSize
/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.description: This defines how many elements to display on each page. It defaults to 300 .You can have a maximum of 1000 elements on each page.Larger values are not allowed because they can crash your browser.

/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.name: minTenderValue
/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/tenderValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.name: maxTenderValue
/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.description: This will filter after tender.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/tenderValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.

/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.name: minAwardValue
/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a minimumUse /api/awardValueInterval to get the minimum allowed.

/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.name: maxAwardValue
/api/totalFlaggedProjectsByIndicatorType.description: This will filter after awards.value.amount and will specify a maximum.Use /api/awardValueInterval to get the maximum allowed.
